name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: For the last week of her show, Oprah will have 20,000 people in the audience. Three of them will be men.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Ron Paul announced that he will run for president, and he supports the legalization of prostitution and heroin. If he does win, it will be one heck of a victory party.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: A woman in California is in trouble for injecting her 8-year-old daughter with Botox. The daughter is the first kid in history that made a face and it really did get stuck that way.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: A new app lets you get items at 7-Eleven without cash or a credit card. The app is known as a gun.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Arnold Schwarzenegger admitted that he fathered a child with a member of his household staff. The woman’s husband became suspicious when he realized she was the first maid to make $1 million a year.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Arnold kept this secret for more than 10 years. You know how he did it? He moved the woman and child into an apartment right down the street from the Pakistani military academy.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Mitt Romney raised over $10 million in eight hours. The guy owns a gas station down the street from my house. It’s no big deal.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Romney raised $10 million. That’s a dollar for every position he’s had on healthcare.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: The members of the family that owns the Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus are suing each other in federal court. There are wild charges and outbursts, and the judge said, “This trial is becoming a three-ring . . . never mind.”

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Cirque du Soleil doesn’t use animals. They exploit a group of creatures even stranger than animals: French Canadians.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: Growing up, I went to the circus every Christmas. It was a very low-rent circus. It was a down and dirty operation that tried to make money off the exploitation of hunchbacked freaks — kind of like this show.

name: Craig Ferguson
monologue: The circus used to make me anxious that the animals would snap their leashes and attack the crowd. It’s the same thing I worry about now when I watch “The View.”

name: David Letterman
monologue: Donald Trump is not running for president. The whole thing was a publicity stunt? Really?

name: David Letterman
monologue: Top Ten Ways To Make The Apocalypse More Fun

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Today is “National Visit Your Relatives Day!” Or as Arnold Schwarzenegger put it, “Better make it two days.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: McDonald’s is changing the recipe of its grilled chicken sandwich to give it quote “a more neutral flavor profile.” I’m getting hungry just hearing the words, “neutral flavor profile.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: McDonald’s actually said they want their chicken sandwich to taste less Italian. Which is why today, they hired the head chef from the Olive Garden.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A recent study found that 92 percent of bear attacks come from male bears, and that mother bears are not as dangerous as once thought. It’s a cool thing to think about while your face is being torn off by a mother bear.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Arnold Schwarzenegger fathered a child with his maid. I can’t believe no one knew this was Arnold’s son. When he came out of the womb, he snapped his own umbilical cord.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: I mostly feel bad for this kid that now has to learn how to spell the name Schwarzenegger.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: Maria Shriver had dinner with Oprah the other night, so Arnold is in a lot of trouble. He should start looking into fortified compounds in Abbottabad.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: We’re about to plunge into depression and national mourning. There are only five episodes of “Oprah” left.
